Medium: Glass; blown in a two-part mold
Credit Line: Edward C. Moore Collection, Bequest of Edward C. Moore, 1891
Description: Translucent yellowish brown.Thick, uneven rim, slightly everted and folded round and in; cylindrical neck, pushed down into body, forming hollow shoulder; uneven, cylindrical body; rounded but lopsided bottom. One continuous mold seam around body, extending to top of neck.Body molded into the shape of a wrinckled date, but with pattern of more regular vertical ridges and hollows.Broken and repaired, with six holes remaining in body; dulling, pitting, creamy white weathering, and brilliant iridescence.
